intro: Kalawael, commonly known as the "Cordia dichotoma," is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in clusters along the stems. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate or elliptical in shape. Kalawael is often found in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in tropical and subtropical climates. Its fruit is a small, fleshy capsule that splits open to release seeds.
